folder: Wyona St. & Fulton St., Brooklyn, NY
text:
Wyona Ave., east side, between Fulton Street and Atlantic Ave., showing the Trinity Church (P.E.). Lyman Cobb, shortly after settling in East New York in 1850, organized the Episcopal Society, which in 1854 purchased this edifice from the Congregation of the Reformed Church. This structure built for church services in 1840, was no longer used as one in 1916. The real estate maps of 1929 show a 4-story brick building on the site.

About 1880.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Negative available in LH&G: Neg. No. 175
